items.author: Michael Rechtshaffen
items.content: Cheadle impressively carries the entire picture, delivering the kind of note-perfect performance that's absolutely deserving of Oscar consideration.

items.author: David Denby
items.content: The film turns into a triumph for Don Cheadle, who never steps outside the character for emotional grandstanding or easy moralism.

items.author: Richard Schickel
items.content: It is a powerful portrait of a slightly befuddled man who, when inhuman demands were placed on him, found within himself an unexpected response.

items.author: Ernest Hardy
items.content: Hotel Rwanda, based on real lives and events, aims unequivocally to break your heart.

items.author: David Ansen
items.content: Ultimately, one's reservations are overwhelmed by the story's urgency; it's impossible not to be shattered.

items.author: Peter Travers
items.content: George has been criticized for simplifying a complex story into an African "Schindler's List." But despite flaws in execution, this is a film of rare courage and imperishable heart.

items.author: Scott Foundas
items.content: The genocide of some one million Rwandan Tutsis by their Hutu neighbors remains a disgraceful and too-little-known episode in recent world history. Alas, Terry George's ineffectual Hotel Rwanda only partly rectifies that problem, taking what ought to have been a complex, powerful inquiry and simplifying it to a story about the resilience of the human spirit.

items.author: Michael Atkinson
items.content: It's a gut-twisting story handled, largely and predictably, with asbestos mitts.

items.author: Kenneth Turan
items.content: The story it tells is such a wrenching one it cannot help but move us, especially when the performance of a lifetime by Don Cheadle is added to the mix.

items.author: Phil Hall
items.content: The film presents the Rwandans in the worst possible way: venal, corrupt, vicious, stupid, barbaric and completely incapable of governing themselves. Honestly, I've seen more intelligent and sympathetic depictions of Africans in Tarzan movies.
